(i) `With confidence, Ara made Nairi speak.' (i.e., Ara was confident, not Nairi)

(i) `With confidence, Ara made Nairi speak.' (i.e., Ara was confident, not Nairi) (ii) `Ara certainly made Nairi speak.

igt.tag-types: L B M M B B M M G T T+AL

tier.item: 2. vst'ah can also be interpreted as a sentential adverb in which case it means `certainly' or `surely'; that interpretation is available
in both morphological and analytic causatives. Moreover, vst'ah is also an adjective meaning `confident'.
(i) `Ara made Nairi speak with confidence.' (i.e., Nairi was confident, not Ara)
2. vst'ah can also be interpreted as a sentential adverb in which case it means `certainly' or `surely'; that interpretation is available
in both morphological and analytic causatives. Moreover, vst'ah is also an adjective meaning `confident'.
(i) `Ara made Nairi speak with confidence.' (i.e., Nairi was confident, not Ara)
2. vst'ah can also be interpreted as a sentential adverb in which case it means `certainly' or `surely'; that interpretation is available
in both morphological and analytic causatives. Moreover, vst'ah is also an adjective meaning `confident'.
(i) `Ara made Nairi speak with confidence.' (i.e., Nairi was confident, not Ara) (ii) `Ara certainly made Nairi speak.
